hypothesis_content.title: Bull-to-Neutral Warning via 3-Day Momentum Divergence with Volatility Compression
hypothesis_content.statement: During a BULL regime, if BTC price makes a new 10-day high while its 3-day Rate of Change (ROC) is lower than its previous 10-day high's 3-day ROC (negative momentum divergence) AND the 10-day realized volatility falls below the 30-day realized volatility (vol compression), a transition to a NEUTRAL regime will occur within the next 8 trading days with >68% probability.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In a BULL regime, slowing momentum (divergence) at new highs combined with declining volatility indicates exhaustion of the trend and a potential consolidation phase. This often precedes a period of profit-taking and range-bound action, characteristic of a NEUTRAL regime, especially after strong rallies.
entry_conditions: 3-day ROC at current high < 3-day ROC at previous 10-day high
BTC 10-day realized volatility < BTC 30-day realized volatility

exit_conditions.take_profit: NEUTRAL regime confirmed (confidence > 65%) OR 6% portfolio gain from hedge/short position entry
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC price rallies > 7% above the divergence high signal

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 32% of such signals fail to trigger a NEUTRAL regime within 8 days, OR the market continues in a BULL regime for more than 20 days post-signal > 50% of the time.
